column4: I've dumped a SD card using dd if=sdb of=file, how can I mount that file w/ the loopback device?
It depends on what kind of file it is.
usr13, It's a simple dd dump
If it is an iso image, yes, loopback is what you need.
An actual perfect copy of a SD card
so why did you not just get the files?
What is your end goal?
usr13, It is a little more complicated than that
It is multi-partitioned, and has a few special stuff on it
YOu should tell us?
usr13, I need to mount it, that's it.
So mount it then.
now we go back to the original question, can you mount a dd dump?
What version of Ubuntu do you have?  lsb_release -r  #Show us.
19.04 Xubuntu release
I mean 12
12.04 XUbuntu
Why not just mount it where it is?
and how to do so? that's my question.
sudo fdisk -l | pastebinit  #Send us resulting URL
what for?
Never mind.
